availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac Newton Webb (Henry County, KY, attorney, judge, and KY House Rep)

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, attorney, hotelkeeper, judge, and politician. Son of Waller Webb and Hannah Young. Married to Levian Gist Webb in 1847. Father of John G. Webb, Minnie Webb, Sallie Webb, Mary Webb, I. Newton Webb, Washington Irving Webb and Waller Webb. Attended Hanover College in Hanover, Indiana .Attorney in Henry County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned fifteen enslaved persons in Henry County in 1860. Judge pro tempore in Henry County in 1862. Member of the House of Representations of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Henry County from 1865 to 1868.
